title: 1923 Cycle-skating film
content:
From this Pathé film clip:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UjtPn4orR9A](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247/https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=UjtPn4orR9A "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UjtPn4orR9A")

author: pj76

comments.content: This is most probably hand-letering and I can't find a modern digital match off-course... but you may like an interesting -similar in style- font from Nick-Curtis [2001]: **[Payzant Pen NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Payzant%20Pen%20NF%20-%20Regular&fid=b2c89e4a61ac7c78c98259d9ced7d63d&fsize=48&text=It's%20Cycle-skating%2C%20and%20comes%20all%20the%20way%20from%20Paris&wrap=2)**

The intertitle lettering artist seems to have been influenced by the style used by lettering artist Elizabeth Colwell. A version of her lettering from 1916 is the basis for a font by Fleisch & Apostrophic called Colwell

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ColwellAsCycle_3950.jpg)
  [http://www.dafont.com/colwell.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247/http:/www.dafont.com/colwell.font "http://www.dafont.com/colwell.font")

A toned down interpretation was published as a font by American Type Founders before 1923. Nick Curtis produced a digital version as McKenna Handletter NF

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247im_/http:/typophile.com/files/McKennaHandletterNFAsCycle_3532.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247im_/http:/typophile.com/files/McKennaHandletterNFAscomes_6633.gif)

Luc Devroye has an informative page on Elizabeth Colwell's lettering and various digital productions [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51178.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416032247/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-51178.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51178.html")  
Don
